devil_mark.description: Did not feel pin inserted on forehead

powder_types: powder to kill people or animals

timeline.subject: Didelon and Bietrix
timeline.details: Claude Liebault, prévôt of Charmes, informs PG des Vosges that Didelon is reputed witch

timeline.subject: Didelon and Bietrix
timeline.details: PG des Vosges at Mirecourt approves arrest; Prévôt records verbal order to hear other witnesses

timeline.subject: Didelon
timeline.details: Reproached for invoking devil; revealed second prayer

timeline.subject: Didelon
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; resisted and denied

timeline.subject: Didelon
timeline.details: Found dead in cell that night with wound on head

timeline.subject: Bietrix
timeline.details: PG asks for execution after confrontation with Nicolas George

timeline.subject: Bietrix
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves execution subject to confession confirmation

prior_accusations.context: Cousin of Didelon, executed as witch 7 years earlier
Brother-in-law of Bietrix, executed 15-16 years earlier at Harouet
Already much suspected according to witness 2

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Cairierencin (witness 1)
notable_quotes.french: mais le deposant qui forcenoit de rage de veoir sondit cheval ainsi malade, luy dit il vous fauldroit faire venir le grand diable pour l'achever
notable_quotes.english: but the witness who was furious with rage to see his horse so sick, said to him you would have to bring the great devil to finish it off
notable_quotes.context: After horse fell from rock and was sick

notable_quotes.speaker: Aulbry Aulbry (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: tu t'en repentiras, les deux blancs de plus que tu luy a fait payer nous cousteront
notable_quotes.english: you will repent of it, the two blancs more that you made him pay will cost us
notable_quotes.context: To son who charged Didelon more for wood transport

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurent Simonin (witness 3)
notable_quotes.french: le sorcier qu'il est a fait perdre le lait a ma vache, elle est ensorcellée
notable_quotes.english: the witch that he is has made my cow lose its milk, it is bewitched
notable_quotes.context: Shouted so accused could hear when cow lost milk

notable_quotes.speaker: Didelon's wife to Claudon Renauldin's wife
notable_quotes.french: grande lieuriere tu nous a osté ceste maison. Je t'advise que tu en sortiras devant nous
notable_quotes.english: great liar you have taken this house from us. I advise you that you will leave before us
notable_quotes.context: During quarrel after death of mare

notable_quotes.speaker: Didelon to Claudon Renauldin
notable_quotes.french: luy cria mercy et luy dit que jamais il ne l'offenseroit, ny ne luy causeroit plus de perte ny dommage
notable_quotes.english: cried mercy to him and told him that he would never offend him, nor cause him any more loss or damage
notable_quotes.context: When Claudon seized him intending to beat him

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Conte (witness 7)
notable_quotes.french: Je ne te crains nullement pour mes vaches car je n'en ai point ny pour mon corps semblablement d'aultant que je sers un meilleur maitre que toy
notable_quotes.english: I do not fear you at all for my cows because I have none, nor for my body either because I serve a better master than you
notable_quotes.context: To Didelon when discussing dead cows

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierson Rouyer (witness 9)
notable_quotes.french: Chacun dit que vous estes sorciers, il vous fault tous brusler
notable_quotes.english: Everyone says that you are witches, you must all be burned

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier Aulbry (witness 15) - Didelon's response to accusations
notable_quotes.french: que Dieu estoit juste et qu'Il scavoit tout
notable_quotes.english: that God was just and that He knew everything

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude fille Thierry Maillard (witness 19)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il falloit bien mieulx le garder a son pere qui lors estoit a la charrue que de le donner a telles gens
notable_quotes.english: that it was much better to keep it for her father who was then at the plough than to give it to such people
notable_quotes.context: About giving wine to Didelon's wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Bietrix in interrogation
notable_quotes.french: que les pauvres gens demeuroient tousjours en leur pauvreté et qu'ilz ont mieulx aymé soufrir des injures que de se plaindre, s'en ayans laissé la vengeance a notre Seigneur
notable_quotes.english: that poor people always remained in their poverty and that they preferred to suffer injuries rather than complain, having left vengeance to our Lord
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why they never sought legal redress for being called witches

notable_quotes.speaker: Didelon - prayer for animals
notable_quotes.french: Beste cornue de tous les maux qui te tiennent que tu en puisse estre guarie au nom de Dieu et du fils de Dieu et de la Vierge Marie, au nom de St Blaise qui est fitcien et gardien sur toutes bestes cornues, qu'il luy plaise de te preserver et garder de tous les maux qui te tiennent
notable_quotes.english: Horned beast from all the evils that hold you may you be cured in the name of God and the son of God and the Virgin Mary, in the name of St Blaise who is physician and guardian over all horned beasts, may it please him to preserve and protect you from all the evils that hold you
notable_quotes.context: Prayer learned from father, said 3 times with 3 paternosters and 3 ave marias

relationships.person2: Jean Lhuilier dit Anthoine de Socourt
relationships.evidence_text: Jean Lhuilier dit Anthoine de Socourt, executed as a witch some 7 years earlier, had been his cousin
Simonin, her brother-in-law of Vaudeville, executed 15 or 16 years earlier at Harouet
sent his son Nicolas to do the job
sent his son aged 12 to guard it
horses of his grandfather Husson Aulbry
small boy called Dieudonné, bastard of one of her daughters

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over: loss of herdsman position (replaced 8 years before arrest); property transactions (purchase of vines, houses); refusal to sell animals; charging for services; disputes over land use (vines not properly enclosed). Economic value of losses frequently mentioned: animals worth 100+ écus, 500 francs, etc. Witness 7 notes suspicion that accused were envied 'because they were seen accumulating some goods'. Poverty mentioned as reason for not seeking legal redress.

Denied almost every charge and circumstantial details

extraction_metadata.notes: This trial is notable for: (1) Didelon died in prison after resisting torture, found dead with wound on head - judges suggested devil killed him; (2) Bietrix confessed under torture immediately; (3) Extraordinarily detailed testimony from 40 witnesses showing long-standing reputation (up to 50 years); (4) Multiple former mayors testified; (5) Pattern of economic disputes (animal sales, services, employment as herdsman, land transactions); (6) Accused repeatedly called witches publicly but never sought legal redress due to poverty; (7) Didelon revealed prayers learned from father for curing animals; (8) Bietrix named Nicolas Sermemont as accomplice at sabbat; (9) Both accused had family members previously executed as witches; (10) Rich detail on folk healing practices and counter-magic; (11) Didelon's body allowed burial in consecrated ground despite PG suggestion for remote burial.
